			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:72.82%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2018&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:03.40%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.54%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:21.24%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;144&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:72.82%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2019&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:03.40%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.54%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:21.24%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:1.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;149&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:72.82%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2020&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:03.40%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.54%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:21.24%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;25&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:72.82%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:03.40%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.54%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:21.24%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:1.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;733&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;During the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 we incurred &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;rental expenses of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;178
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$213
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  




  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Liquidity &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;As of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 we had cash and cash-equivalents of approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$857&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
000 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$1.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively
 and working capital of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$2.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$3.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively. Cash used in operations during fiscal years &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; totaled &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;1.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;million &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$317
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively. Our cash flows vary throughout the year based on seasonality.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;For the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 net cash provided by financing activities totaled &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$656
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; primarily from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;stock &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;option exercises. This compares to net cash provided by financing activities for the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 which totaled approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$61
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 primarily from warrant exercises
 offset by our capital lease payments. We incurred a net loss of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$1.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; for the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. Our accumulated deficit increased to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$59.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; compared to the prior year&amp;#x2019;s deficit of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$58.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;As of the date of this Report
 we believe that our current cash and cash equivalents will be sufficient to meet our anticipated cash needs through &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December&amp;nbsp;31
 2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. Additionally
 our Loan Facility (described below)
 is available for our working capital needs. Beginning in 2012
 we made significant reductions in operating expenses and personnel
 primarily in the second half of 2012
 to better align our operations with available capital and slow our cash used in operations. We have continued at these reduced operating expense levels. We believe that these cost controls and realigned expenses are strategically important to further the Company's long-term viability.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We have a revolving secured credit facility (the &amp;#x201C;Loan Facility&amp;#x201D;) with &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;CapitalSource Business Finance Group (previously known as &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;BFI Business Finance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; (&amp;#x201C;BFI&amp;#x201D;). The Loan Facility allows us to borrow a maximum aggregate amount of up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$2.0 million based on eligible accounts receivable and inventory. As of December 31
 2014
 our eligible borrowing base was approximately $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;1.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million
 for which we had no outstanding balance. (The Loan Facility is described in Note 5 to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Consolidated Financial Statements &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;in this Report.)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; We may use the Loan Facility for our working capital needs.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;During 2014
 we received $6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;69&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
000 from the cash exercise of stock options &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;primarily &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;by our CEO&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;but also including &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;several of our directors&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; officers&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and employees. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;From t&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;ime to time
 w&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;e may receive additional cash through the exercise of stock options or warrants in the future. However
 we cannot predict the timing or amount of cash proceeds we may receive from the exercise
 if at all
 of any of the outstanding stock options or warrants.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We may require additional financing to support our working capital needs in the future. The amount of additional capital we may require
 the timing of our capital needs and the availability of financing to fund those needs will depend on a number of factors
 including our strategic initiatives and operating plans
 the performance of our business and the market conditions for debt or equity financing. Additionally
 the amount of capital required will depend on our ability to meet our case sales goals and otherwise successfully execute our operating plan. We believe it is imperative to meet these sales objectives in order to lessen our reliance on external financing in the future. We intend to continually monitor and adjust our business plan as necessary to respond to developments in our business
 our markets and the broader economy. Although we believe various debt and equity financing alternatives will be available to us to support our working capital needs
 financing arrangements on acceptable terms may not be available to us when needed. Additionally
 these alternatives may require significant cash payments for interest and other costs or could be highly dilutive to our existing shareholders. Any such financing alternatives may not provide us with sufficient funds to meet our long-term capital requirements. If necessary
 we may explore strategic transactions that we consider to be in the best interest of the Company and our shareholders
 which may include
 without limitation
 public or private offerings of debt or equity securities
 a rights offering
 and other strategic alternatives; however
 these options may not ultimately be available or feasible.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The uncertainties relating to our ability to successfully execute on our business plan and finance our operations continue to raise substantial doubt about our ability to continue as a going concern. Our financial statements for the periods presented were prepared assuming we would continue as a going concern
 which contemplates that we will continue in operation for the foreseeable future and will be able to realize assets and settle liabilities and commitments in the normal course of business. These financial statements do not include any adjustments to reflect the possible future effects on the recoverability and classification of assets or the amounts and classifications of liabilities that could result should we be unable to continue as a going concern.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12.25pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Recent accounting guidance&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;In May 2014
 the Financial Accounting Standard Board
 or FASB
 issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2014-09
 Revenue from Contracts with Customers: Topic 606 (ASU 2014-09). To supersede nearly all existing revenue recognition guidance under generally accepted accounting princ&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;iples in the United States
 or &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;GAAP. The core principle of ASU 2014-09 is to recognize revenues when promised goods or services are transferred to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration that is expected to be received for those goods or services. ASU 2014-09 defines a five steps process to achieve this core principle and
 in doing so
 it is possible more judgment and estimates may be required within the revenue recognition process than required under existing GAAP including identifying performance obligations in the contract
 estimating the amount of variable consideration to include in the transaction price and allocating the transaction price to each separate performance obligation. ASU 2014-09 is effective for the fiscal and interim reporting periods beginning after December 15
 2016 using either of two methods: (i) retrospective to each prior reporting period presented within the option to elect certain practical expedients as defined within ASU 2014-09; or (ii) retrospective with the cumulative effect of initially applying ASU 2014-09 recognized at the date of initial application and providing certain additional disclosures as defined per ASU 2014-09. We are currently evaluating the impact of our pending adoption of ASU 2014-09 on our consolidated financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;In August 2014
 the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2014-15
 Presentation of Financial Statements &amp;#x2013; Going Concern: Topic 915 (ASU 2014-15) Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&amp;#x2019;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
 which states that in connection with preparing financial statements for each annual and interim reporting period
 an entity&amp;#x2019;s management should evaluate whether there are conditions or events
 considered in the aggregate
 that raise substantial doubt about the entity&amp;#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern within one year after the date that the financial statements are issued (or within one year after the date that the financial statements are available to be issued when applicable). The adoption of this update did not have a material effect on the Company&amp;#x2019;s financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:03.40%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.54%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:21.24%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12.25pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Fixed assets&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Fixed assets are recorded at cost less accumulated depreciation and depreciated on the declining balance basis over the estimated useful lives of the assets as follows:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:48.78%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.44%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:48.78%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:48.78%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 8pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-size:8pt;&gt;Asset&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.44%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:48.78%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 8pt&gt;

						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Revenue recognition&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We recognize revenue when persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists
 delivery has occurred
 the sales price is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assured. Revenue is recorded net of provisions for discounts
 slotting fees and promotion allowances. For the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 our revenue was reduced by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$1.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$2.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;respectively
 for slotting fees and promotion allowances. All sales to distributors and customers are final; however
 in limited instances
 due to product quality issues or distributor terminations
 we may accept returned product. To date
 such returns have not been material.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-indent: -36pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;13. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;;font-size: 10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt;padding:0pt 24pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Segment Information&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We have &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;one&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; operating segment with operations primarily in the United States and Canada. Sales are assigned to geographic locations based on the location of customers.  three of our customers represented approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;37%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;36%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively of revenues.&lt;/font&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;&gt;Shipping and handling costs&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Shipping and handling amounts paid to us by customers are&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; primarily for online orders
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; included in revenue and total &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;33
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;305
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; for the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;During 2014
 we incorporated shipping and handling fees into the product price
 which caused the decrease in shipping and handling revenue from prior year. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The actual costs of shipping and handling paid by us are included in cost of sales.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  

		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table style=width:100%; cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:0pt;&gt;&lt;p style=width:0pt;font-size:0pt;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td valign=top align=left style=width: 18.00pt; display: inline;&gt;
			&lt;p style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt;margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;;&gt; 1.&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:18pt;&gt;&lt;p style=width:18pt;width:18pt;font-size:0pt;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td align=left valign=top&gt;
			&lt;p style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt;margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;&gt;Nature of Operations and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Jones Soda Co. develops
 produces
 markets and distributes premium beverages which &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;it&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; sell&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;s&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and distribute&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;s&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; primarily in the United States and Canada&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; through &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;its&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; network of independent distributors and directly to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;its&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; national and regional retail accounts.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We are a Washington corporation and have two operating subsidiaries
 Jones Soda Co. (USA) Inc. and Jones Soda (Canada) Inc. (Subsidiaries).&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Basis of presentation and consolidation&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The accompanying consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (GAAP) and the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) rules and regulations applicable to financial reporting. The consolidated financial statements include our accounts and accounts of our wholly owned subsidiaries. All intercompany transactions between us and our subsidiaries have been eliminated in consolidation.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Liquidity &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;As of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 we had cash and cash-equivalents of approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$857&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
000 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$1.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 respectively
 and working capital of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$2.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$3.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 respectively. Cash used in operations during fiscal years &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; totaled &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;1.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;million &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$317
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 respectively. Our cash flows vary throughout the year based on seasonality.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;For the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 net cash provided by financing activities totaled &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$656
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; primarily from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;stock &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;option exercises. This compares to net cash provided by financing activities for the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 which totaled approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$61
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 primarily from warrant exercises
 offset by our capital lease payments. We incurred a net loss of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$1.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; for the year ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;. Our accumulated deficit increased to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$59.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; compared to the prior year&amp;#x2019;s deficit of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$58.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;As of the date of this Report
 we believe that our current cash and cash equivalents will be sufficient to meet our anticipated cash needs through &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December&amp;nbsp;31
 2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;. Additionally
 our Loan Facility (described below)
 is available for our working capital needs. Beginning in 2012
 we made significant reductions in operating expenses and personnel
 primarily in the second half of 2012
 to better align our operations with available capital and slow our cash used in operations. We have continued at these reduced operating expense levels. We believe that these cost controls and realigned expenses are strategically important to further the Company's long-term viability.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We have a revolving secured credit facility (the &amp;#x201C;Loan Facility&amp;#x201D;) with &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;CapitalSource Business Finance Group (previously known as &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;BFI Business Finance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; (&amp;#x201C;BFI&amp;#x201D;). The Loan Facility allows us to borrow a maximum aggregate amount of up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$2.0 million based on eligible accounts receivable and inventory. As of December 31
 2014
 our eligible borrowing base was approximately $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;1.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million
 for which we had no outstanding balance. (The Loan Facility is described in Note 5 to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Consolidated Financial Statements &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;in this Report.)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; We may use the Loan Facility for our working capital needs.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;During 2014
 we received $6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;69&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
000 from the cash exercise of stock options &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;primarily &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;by our CEO&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;but also including &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;several of our directors&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; officers&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and employees. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;From t&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;ime to time
 w&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;e may receive additional cash through the exercise of stock options or warrants in the future. However
 we cannot predict the timing or amount of cash proceeds we may receive from the exercise
 if at all
 of any of the outstanding stock options or warrants.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We may require additional financing to support our working capital needs in the future. The amount of additional capital we may require
 the timing of our capital needs and the availability of financing to fund those needs will depend on a number of factors
 including our strategic initiatives and operating plans
 the performance of our business and the market conditions for debt or equity financing. Additionally
 the amount of capital required will depend on our ability to meet our case sales goals and otherwise successfully execute our operating plan. We believe it is imperative to meet these sales objectives in order to lessen our reliance on external financing in the future. We intend to continually monitor and adjust our business plan as necessary to respond to developments in our business
 our markets and the broader economy. Although we believe various debt and equity financing alternatives will be available to us to support our working capital needs
 financing arrangements on acceptable terms may not be available to us when needed. Additionally
 these alternatives may require significant cash payments for interest and other costs or could be highly dilutive to our existing shareholders. Any such financing alternatives may not provide us with sufficient funds to meet our long-term capital requirements. If necessary
 we may explore strategic transactions that we consider to be in the best interest of the Company and our shareholders
 which may include
 without limitation
 public or private offerings of debt or equity securities
 a rights offering
 and other strategic alternatives; however
 these options may not ultimately be available or feasible.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The uncertainties relating to our ability to successfully execute on our business plan and finance our operations continue to raise substantial doubt about our ability to continue as a going concern. Our financial statements for the periods presented were prepared assuming we would continue as a going concern
 which contemplates that we will continue in operation for the foreseeable future and will be able to realize assets and settle liabilities and commitments in the normal course of business. These financial statements do not include any adjustments to reflect the possible future effects on the recoverability and classification of assets or the amounts and classifications of liabilities that could result should we be unable to continue as a going concern.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:14pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Use of estimates&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The preparation of the consolidated financial statements requires management to make a number of estimates and assumptions relating to the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the consolidated financial statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expenses during the reporting period. Significant items subject to such estimates and assumptions include
 but are not limited to
 inventory valuation
 depreciable lives and valuation of capital assets
 valuation allowances for receivables
 trade promotion liabilities
 stock-based compensation expense
 valuation allowance for deferred income tax assets
 contingencies
 and forecasts supporting the going concern assumption and related disclosures. Actual results could differ from those estimates.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Cash and cash equivalents&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We consider all highly liquid short-term investments with an original or remaining maturity of three months or less at the date of purchase to be cash equivalents.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:14pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Fair value of financial instruments&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The carrying amounts for cash and cash equivalents
 receivables and payables approximate fair value due to the short-term maturity of these instruments. The carrying value of other long-term liabilities approximated fair values because the underlying interest rates approximate market rates at the balance sheet dates.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Accounts receivable&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Our accounts receivable balance includes balances from trade sales to distributors and retail customers. The allowance for doubtful accounts is our best estimate of the amount of probable credit losses in our existing accounts receivable. We determine the allowance for doubtful accounts based primarily on historical write-off experience. Account balances that are deemed uncollectible
 are charged off against the allowance after all means of collection have been exhausted and the potential for recovery is considered remote. Allowances for doubtful accounts of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;49&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;42&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 respectively
 are netted against accounts receivable. Activity in the allowance for doubtful accounts consists of the following for the years ended December 31 (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Balance
 beginning of year &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.04%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:12.74%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;42&amp;nbsp;

			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12.25pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Inventories&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Inventories consist of raw materials and finished goods and are stated at the lower of cost or market and include adjustments for estimated obsolete or excess inventory. Cost is based on actual cost on a first-in first-out basis. Raw materials that will be used in production in the next twelve months are recorded in inventory. The provisions for obsolete or excess inventory are based on estimated forecasted usage of inventories. A significant change in demand for certain products as compared to forecasted amounts may result in recording additional provisions for obsolete inventory. Provisions for obsolete or excess inventory are recorded as cost of goods sold. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12.25pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Fixed assets&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Fixed assets are recorded at cost less accumulated depreciation and depreciated on the declining balance basis over the estimated useful lives of the assets as follows:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:48.78%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.44%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:48.78%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Shorter of useful life or lease term&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:48.78%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Equipment under capital lease &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:02.44%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:48.78%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Lease term which approximates its useful life&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12.25pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Impairment of long-lived assets&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Long-lived assets
 which include capital and intangible assets
 are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable. Recoverability of assets to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of the assets to future undiscounted net cash flows expected to be generated by the assets. If such assets are considered to be impaired
 the impairment to be recognized is measured by the amount by which the carrying amount of the assets exceeds the fair value of the assets. The fair value of the assets is estimated using the higher of discounted future cash flows of the assets or estimated net realizable value. Long-lived assets are grouped at the lowest level for which there are identifiable cash flows when evaluating for impairment. Assets to be disposed of are reported at the lower of the carrying amount or fair value less costs to sell. There are no unamortized intangible assets as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Foreign currency translation&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The functional currency of our Canadian subsidiary is the Canadian dollar. We translate assets and liabilities related to these operations to U.S.&amp;nbsp;dollars at the exchange rate in effect at the date of the consolidated balance sheet; we convert revenues and expenses into U.S.&amp;nbsp;dollars using the average monthly exchange rates. Translation gains and losses are reported as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Revenue recognition&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We recognize revenue when persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists
 delivery has occurred
 the sales price is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assured. Revenue is recorded net of provisions for discounts
 slotting fees and promotion allowances. For the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 our revenue was reduced by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$1.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$2.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;respectively
 for slotting fees and promotion allowances. All sales to distributors and customers are final; however
 in limited instances
 due to product quality issues or distributor terminations
 we may accept returned product. To date
 such returns have not been material.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Shipping and handling costs&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Shipping and handling amounts paid to us by customers are&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; primarily for online orders
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; included in revenue and total &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;33
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;305
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; for the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;During 2014
 we incorporated shipping and handling fees into the product price
 which caused the decrease in shipping and handling revenue from prior year. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The actual costs of shipping and handling paid by us are included in cost of sales.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Advertising costs&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Advertising costs
 which also include promotions and sponsorships
 are expensed as incurred. During the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 we incurred advertising costs of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;66&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;15&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Income taxes&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We account for income taxes by recognizing the amount of taxes payable for the current year and deferred tax assets and liabilities for future tax consequences of events at enacted tax rates that have been recognized in our financial statements or tax returns. We perform periodic evaluations of recorded tax assets and liabilities and maintain a valuation allowance
 if considered necessary. The determination of taxes payable for the current year includes estimates. We believe that we have appropriate support for the income tax positions taken
 and to be taken
 on our tax returns and that our accruals for tax liabilities are adequate for all open years based on an assessment of many factors including past experience and interpretations of tax law applied to the facts of each matter. No reserves for an uncertain income tax position have been recorded for the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; or &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Net loss per share&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Basic net loss per share is computed using the weighted average number of common shares outstanding during the periods. Diluted earnings per share is computed by adjusting the weighted average number of common shares by the effective net exercise or conversion of all dilutive securities. In &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 due to the net loss
 all outstanding &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;stock &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;options and warrants are anti-dilutive.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Comprehensive loss&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Comprehensive loss is comprised of net loss and other adjustments
 including items such as non-U.S.&amp;nbsp;currency translation adjustments. We do not provide income taxes on currency translation adjustments
 as the historical earnings from our Canadian subsidiary is considered to be indefinitely reinvested.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Seasonality&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Our&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; sales are seasonal and we experience fluctuations in quarterly results as a result of many factors. We historically have generated a greater percentage of our revenues during the warm weather months of April through September. Timing of customer purchases will vary each year and sales can be expected to shift from one quarter to another. As a result
 management believes that period-to-period comparisons of results of operations are not necessarily meaningful and should not be relied upon as any indication of future performance or results expected for the fiscal year.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:13pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:12.25pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Recent accounting guidance&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In May 2014
 the Financial Accounting Standard Board
 or FASB
 issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2014-09
 Revenue from Contracts with Customers: Topic 606 (ASU 2014-09). To supersede nearly all existing revenue recognition guidance under generally accepted accounting princ&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;iples in the United States
 or &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;GAAP. The core principle of ASU 2014-09 is to recognize revenues when promised goods or services are transferred to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration that is expected to be received for those goods or services. ASU 2014-09 defines a five steps process to achieve this core principle and
 in doing so
 it is possible more judgment and estimates may be required within the revenue recognition process than required under existing GAAP including identifying performance obligations in the contract
 estimating the amount of variable consideration to include in the transaction price and allocating the transaction price to each separate performance obligation. ASU 2014-09 is effective for the fiscal and interim reporting periods beginning after December 15
 2016 using either of two methods: (i) retrospective to each prior reporting period presented within the option to elect certain practical expedients as defined within ASU 2014-09; or (ii) retrospective with the cumulative effect of initially applying ASU 2014-09 recognized at the date of initial application and providing certain additional disclosures as defined per ASU 2014-09. We are currently evaluating the impact of our pending adoption of ASU 2014-09 on our consolidated financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In August 2014
 the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2014-15
 Presentation of Financial Statements &amp;#x2013; Going Concern: Topic 915 (ASU 2014-15) Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&amp;#x2019;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
 which states that in connection with preparing financial statements for each annual and interim reporting period
 an entity&amp;#x2019;s management should evaluate whether there are conditions or events
 considered in the aggregate
 that raise substantial doubt about the entity&amp;#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern within one year after the date that the financial statements are issued (or within one year after the date that the financial statements are available to be issued when applicable). The adoption of this update did not have a material effect on the Company&amp;#x2019;s financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-indent: -36pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;9.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;;font-size: 10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt;padding:0pt 30pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Shareholders&amp;#x2019; Equity&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Under the terms of our 2011 Incentive Plan (Plan)
 the number of shares authorized under the Plan may be increased each January 1st by an amount equal to the least of (a) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;1
300
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares
 (b) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;4.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; of our outstanding common stock as of the end of our immediately preceding fiscal year
 and (c) a lesser amount determined by the Board of Directors (the Board)
 provided that the number of shares that may be granted pursuant to awards in a single year may not exceed &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;10&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; of our outstanding shares of common stock on a fully diluted basis as of the end of the immediately preceding fiscal year. Effective January 1
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 the total number of shares of common stock authorized under the Plan increased to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;6
884
032&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Under the terms of the Plan
 the Board may grant awards to employees
 officers
 directors
 consultants
 agents
 advisors and independent contractors. Awards may consist of stock options
 stock appreciation rights
 stock awards
 restricted stock
 stock units
 performance awards or other stock or cash-based awards. Stock options are granted at the closing price of our stock on the date of grant
 and generally have a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;ten&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;-year term and vest over a period of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;48&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;months&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; with the first &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;25.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; cliff vesting &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;one&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; year&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; from the grant date and monthly thereafter. As of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;December 31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 there were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;2
461
871&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares of unissued common stock authorized and available for future awards under the Plan.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table style=width:100%; cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:0pt;&gt;&lt;p style=width:0pt;font-size:0pt;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td valign=top align=left style=width: 18.00pt; display: inline;&gt;
			&lt;p style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt;margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;;&gt; (a)&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:0pt;&gt;&lt;p style=width:0pt;width:0pt;font-size:0pt;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td align=left valign=top&gt;
			&lt;p style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt;margin:7pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Stock options:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:7pt 0pt;text-indent:23.05pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;A summary of our stock option activity is as follows:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 18pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:61.22%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.84%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.84%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.38%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:18.02%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:61.22%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.84%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td colspan=4 valign=middle style=width:00.02%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
